articles.author: Sebastian Kettley
articles.title: Starlink satellites in May: Can you see Starlink tonight? UK SpaceX Starlink tracker - Express.co.uk
articles.description: SPACEX'S Starlink satellites have been reported up and down the country - but can you see Starlink tonight?
articles.content:
Starlink visibility from London
Timings with good visibility:
9.26pm - Starlink-3 - For five minutes.
Look from the southwest to the east.
10.01pm, May 5 - Starlink-3 - For six minutes.
Look from the southwest to the east.
Timings with poor visibility:… [+426 chars]

articles.author: Carly Cassella
articles.title: Scientists Have Discovered Fixed Nitrogen in a Martian Meteorite For The First Time - ScienceAlert
articles.description: A fresh new look at a 4 billion-year-old Martian meteorite has revealed organic compounds containing nitrogen - the first real evidence of fixed nitrogen molecules on the Red Planet.
articles.content:
A fresh new look at a 4 billion-year-old Martian meteorite has revealed organic compounds containing nitrogen - the first real evidence of fixed nitrogen molecules on the Red Planet.
Nitrogen is essential for all known forms of life, and while there's curren… [+3255 chars]

articles.author: Neil Shaw
articles.title: Stunning meteor shower from tail of Halley's Comet will light up our skies - Kent Live
articles.description: The Eta Aquariid meteor shower is expected to peak on May 5
articles.content:
Skygazers can look forward to seeing several shooting stars on Tuesday night, as the Earth passes through the dust left over from Halleys Comet.
The Eta Aquariid meteor shower is expected to peak on the night of May 5, with up to 40 meteors per hour, and wil… [+2267 chars]

articles.title: We Don't Want to Alarm Anyone, But a Large Amount of Siberia Is on Fire Right Now - ScienceAlert
articles.description: For the Northern Hemisphere, spring is here – a time to start packing away winter jackets, and enjoying sunbaking on the deck.
articles.content:
For the Northern Hemisphere, spring is here a time to start packing away winter jackets, and enjoying sunbaking on the deck.
But increasing warmth can also bring fires, and in Siberia and the Russian Far East, the situation is already looking pretty dire.

articles.description: NORTH Wales Police have raised concerns for a missing teenager from Flintshire.
articles.content:
NORTH Wales Police have confirmed that a Deeside teenager has been found safe and well.

articles.content: NASA satellites have provided more data than ever before on what has been happening to Antarctica and Greenland's ice over the past 16 years with dire, if not entirely unexpected, findings. Both polar ice sheets are losing billions of tonnes of ice every year… [+2319 chars]

articles.title: ‘Sick of being in a simulator!’ Real reason Michael Collins quit after Apollo 11 revealed - Express.co.uk
articles.description: MICHAEL COLLINS quit the Apollo programme after his role in the Moon landing, but the former test pilot revealed the real reason for his departure was more personal than professional.

articles.title: Space travel breakthrough: Solar sail offers route to stars at one fifth of light speed - Express.co.uk
articles.description: TRIALS of a pioneering solar sail will mark the latest phase of a process which will see human beings become a space-faring species, astrophysicist Avi Loeb, one of the scientists masterminding the Breakthrough Starshot project has said.

articles.title: Moroccan Shows Dinosaur ‘Like No Other’ Could Swim Using Tail - Morocco World News
articles.description: German-Moroccan paleontologist Nizar Ibrahim has published new evidence that spinosaurid dinosaurs could swim, using their tails to propel them in water.
articles.content: The fossil tail suggests the Spinosaurus aegyptiacus could swim, a departure from the commonly-held belief non-avian dinosaurs could not swim.Rabat – German-Moroccan paleontologist Nizar Ibrahim has published new evidence that spinosaurid dinosaurs could swim… [+2119 chars]
